result.execSummary:
The defendant Lonnie Lapone Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin(>10-50g) [Modifiers: Second or Subsequent Offense], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)3.
  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>15-40g) [Modifiers: Second or Subsequent Offense], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)3.
  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin (<=3g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)1.
  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: AS TO EACH COUNT:  Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Cash bail on deposit shall apply. Any remaining balance shall be due no later than 12-31-2020; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. If there is a balance of bail, remaining bail shall be released to Attorney Russel Jones. Fine set at ZERO.
Concurrent with: concurrent with Count 2, 3, 6 of 15CF1111 and consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 4 days (3-10-2015 to 03-13-2015) time served.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
Defendant may not live where a firearm is kept.

No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $200.00 at one time.
No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
Defendant my not have more than one phone number registered to your name at one time. 
Under section 973.049 Court finds and prohibits contact with Charese Gardner as they were witnesses in the crime in COUNT 1, 2, and 3, and it is in the interest of the public to prohibit contact.
Defendant may not travel outside of the State of residence during extended supervision, unless prior approval from agent.

Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders.
Provide a DNA sample, if not already done.
Drivers license suspension is not imposed as to Counts 1, 2, and 3.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment. Maintain absolute sobriety.  
Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: concurrent with Count 1, 3, 6 of 15CF1111 and consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 4 days (3-10-2015 to 03-13-2015) time served.
Concurrent with: concurrent with Count 1, 2, 6 of 15CF1111 and consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 4 days (3-10-2015 to 03-13-2015) time served.

Defendant Lonnie Lapone Davis in court with attorney Russell J. A. Jones.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.

AS TO COUNT 1-
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 12 YEARS, concurrent with Count 2, 3, 6 of 15CF1111 and consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 4 days (3-10-2015 to 03-13-2015) time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 6 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 6 YEARS.  

AS TO COUNT 2-
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 12 YEARS, concurrent with Count 1, 3, 6 of 15CF1111 and consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 4 days (3-10-2015 to 03-13-2015) time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 6 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 6 YEARS.  

AS TO COUNT 3-
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 11 YEARS, concurrent with Count 1, 2, 6 of 15CF1111 and consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 4 days (3-10-2015 to 03-13-2015) time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 6 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.  

AS TO COUNT 6-
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 8 YEARS, concurrent with Count 1, 2, and 3 of 15CF1111 and consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 4 days (3-10-2015 to 03-13-2015) time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 4 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS.  

AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, 3 AND 6:

Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 

- Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Cash bail on deposit shall apply. Any remaining balance shall be due no later than 12-31-2020; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. If there is a balance of bail, remaining bail shall be released to Attorney Russel Jones. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $200.00 at one time.
- No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
- Defendant my not have more than one phone number registered to your name at one time. 
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Defendant may not live where a firearm is kept. 
- Seek/Maintain fulltime employment. 
- Under section 973.049 Court finds and prohibits contact with Charese Gardner as they were witnesses in the crime in COUNT 1, 2, and 3, and it is in the interest of the public to prohibit contact.
- Defendant may not travel outside of the State of residence during extended supervision, unless prior approval from agent.
- Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders.
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Drivers license suspension is not imposed as to Counts 1, 2, and 3.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.


Appellate rights notice given to the defendant.

Defendant Lonnie Lapone Davis in court with attorney Russell J. A. Jones.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.

Case set for final pretrial. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Case proceeded to plea hearing.
  
AS TO COUNT 1, 2, 3, 6 :

The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

AS TO COUNT 4, 5: Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered counts dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, any victims and the defendant.   Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 3 business days in advance of the sentencing. 

Court vacated jury trial scheduled on 09-23-2015.  Case adjourned for sentencing hearing on 10-06-2015 at 8:30 am, branch 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lonnie Lapone Davis in court with attorney Russell J. A. Jones.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Case heard for Br. 17.  Hearing on motion to suppress statements proceeds.  Sworn-in for the State: Milwaukee Police Detective Vincent Lopez.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Testimony closed.  Arguments by counsel.   Court makes findings of fact.  Court orders the statements made in the living room about the key and bedroom are suppressed.  The statements made in living room about gun, money and mattress and "no need to tear up the house" are not suppressed.  The statements made in the hallway at the police station are not suppressed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Case spun to Branch 22 for motion hearing, due to Branch 17 calendar. Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Witkowiak, branch 22.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Konkol, Br. 44.
